description: New JMH preprint on ethical experiences in teletherapy apps.
New MobileHCI paper on multimodal food journaling.
Our CHI paper on CLOVA CareCall received a Best Paper Award!
Three CHI papers on customizing smartwatches and co-regulating with them, and LLMs for public health.
I'm on parental leave this Winter, so I might be slow to get to your email.
Three new CSCW papers on SnapPI, contact tracing and piggyback prototyping.
Welcome to Matthew Dressa, and new IMWUT paper on semi-automated food journaling!
New CSCW paper on caregiver tracking & new CHI papers on supporting longitudinal regimens and contact tracing.
New IMWUT paper on tracking app selection and book chapter on mobile visualization in everyday life.
Three new CSCW papers on contact tracing, online health communities, and food journaling.
New JMH paper on perspectives on mood tracking apps, and we were selected to participate in Snap's Creative Challenge!
Two new DIS papers on food journaling description practices and cultural norms.
Received an ICTS Pilot Grant to improve tools for tapering off antidepressants!
Two CHI papers on contact tracing and child-owned wearables.
New IMWUT paper on tacking stock of the personal informatics literature, with related paper browser. A real team effort!
Happy first day of school to new Ph.D. students Eunkyung Jo and Dennis Wang!
Two new CSCW papers, on child-oriented activity trackers and data-driven stickers!
Upcoming paper on family fitness tracking.
New camera-ready for Yarn, an app for structured storytelling with tracked data (video).
First day of Stacy Branham and my reading group on Moving Human Subjects Research Online.
Working on organizing a remote lab in the era of social distancing. Stay safe, everyone!
Back at it for Winter. Teaching a special topics course on personal informatics.
Two new preprints! Measuring Menses and A Life of Data.
First day of classes. Teaching IN4MATX 133 and 231 this quarter.
CHI submissions made! Proud of the work my students and collaborators submitted.
Visiting student Dakyung Go from the I‑SURF program explored how mobility impairments impact activity tracker use.
Received a small grant from the Clue Research Innovation Program to examine fertility tracking practices.
Great poster session for the Ubiquitous Computing class!
Awarded a small interal grant to examine the design of data-driven stickers on social media.
NSF CRII Awarded! Examining multimodal approaches to food journaling.
First day of Winter Quarter. Teaching graduate-level Ubiquitous Computing.
